interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Michael Jackson's This Is It
Review Date: 2017/05/12
Store: Michael Jackson  (Actor),     Kenny Ortega  (Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Michael Jackson’s THIS IS IT is a rare, behind-the-scenes look at the performer as he developed, created and rehearsed for his sold-out concerts at London’s O2 Arena. Chronicling the months from April through June 2009, this film was produced with the full support of the Estate of Michael Jackson and drawn from more than one hundred hours of behind-the-scenes footage featuring Jackson rehearsing a number of his songs for the show. In raw and candid detail, Michael Jackson’s THIS IS IT captures the singer, dancer, filmmaker, architect, creative genius and great artist at work as he creates and perfects his planned final London shows.', 'Amazon.com', "It's hard not to watch", 'This Is It', "without feeling a mixture of sorrow and elation. When he passed away in the summer of 2009, Michael Jackson was in the midst of rehearsals for his final tour, an ambitious 50-date engagement. In editing 120 hours of rehearsal footage together, Jackson producer Kenny Ortega proves that it would've been an event for the ages. Michael performs material that spans his career, from a Motown medley to multi-platinum hits from", 'Off the Wall', ',', 'Thriller', ', and', 'Bad', '. Though he hadn\'t toured in 10 years, it becomes instantly apparent, despite rumors to the contrary, that Jackson was still in full possession of that unmistakable voice--high-pitched whoops and all--and that he still had the gravity-defying moves of a man half his age. Jackson and Ortega also collaborated on some real showstoppers, such as a graveyard-set "Thriller"; an imposing "They Don\'t Care About Us," in which several dancers appear to morph into thousands; and a film noir sequence in which the singer slides in and out of', 'Gilda', 'and other black-and-white classics, singing "Smooth Criminal" all the while. Not everything works, like the Jackson 5 numbers, in which he flubs a few lyrics, claiming that his earpiece isn\'t working properly, but as he readily acknowledges, "That\'s what rehearsal is for." It\'s a tragedy that he didn\'t get the chance to share this dazzling show with the world, but Ortega allows fans to feel as if it actually happened--at least onscreen.', '--Kathleen C. Fennessy', 'Stills from', 'Michael Jackson: This Is It', '(Click for larger image)']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary, Music', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Closed-captioned, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael Jackson, Kenny Ortega', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.56 x 4.99 x 7.82 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '33882', 'Director': 'Kenny Ortega', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Closed-captioned, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 26, 2010', 'Actors': 'Michael Jackson', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Awesome movie. I feel sad watching it and hearing his music, he was so talented and troubled at the same time. This really shows his process.
Review Title: Awesome movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Day After [DVD]
Jason Robards  (Actor),     JoBeth Williams  (Actor),     Nicholas Meyer  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
['The countdown has begun! Against the real-life backdrop of the U.S. deployment of WMDs in Europe during the escalating Cold War, this "dramatically involving [and] agonizingly graphic film" (The Hollywood Reporter) about nuclear holocaust detonated a direct hit into the heartland of America.Starring Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steven Guttenberg, John Cullum and John Lithgow, this "controversial, potent drama" (Leonard Maltin) remains "one of the most talked-about programs in history"(Newsweek)! When Cold War tensions reach the ultimate boiling point, the inhabitants of a small town in Kansas learn along with the rest of America that they have fewer than 30 minutes before 300 Soviet warheads begin to appear overhead! Can anyone survive this ultimate nightmare...or the nuclear winter that is sure to follow?']
{'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Steve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John CullumSteve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John Cullum   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Nicholas Meyer', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 18, 2004', 'Actors': 'Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steve Guttenberg, John Cullum, John Lithgow', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Edward Hume', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I was a teenager when this came out. My folks let me stay up to watch it. Scared the crap out of me. Nuclear War was my boogie man, it kept me up at night.
Scared the crap out of me.
Sharknado Triple Feature (Sharknado / The Second One / Oh Hell No!)
Ian Ziering  (Actor),     Tara Reid  (Actor),     Anthony C. Ferrante  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
['SharknadoWhen a freak hurricane swamps Los Angeles, thousands of sharks terrorize the waterlogged populace, and nature s deadliest killer rules sea, land, and air.Special Features: The Making of Sharknado, Cast & Crew Commentary, Gag Reel & TrailersSharknado 2: The Second OneWhen a Category 7 hurricane pummels New York, the surging flood waters bring thousands of sharks. To make matters worse, tornadoes soon dot the horizon, As Sharknadoes tear through the city, no vehicle, building, or national monument is safe. Special Features: The Making of Sharknado 2, Shark Chum: From the Cutting Room Floor, Gag Reel, Cameos: I can t Believe They Got..., Director s Commentary with Ian Ziering and Tara Reid & TrailersSharknado 3: Oh Hell No!When a mass of Sharknadoes threatens America s East Coast, chainsaw-wielding hero Fin must again risk his life to save his children on spring break. But as he fights his way south, the sharknadoes merge and grow bigger.Special Features: The Making of Sharknado 3, The Evolution of Sharknado VFX, VFX Before and After, Gag Reel & many more!']

["From director Michael Bay and executive producer Steven Spielberg comes the best TRANSFORMERS ever! With humanity facing extinction from a terrifying new threat, it's up to Optimus Prime and the Autobots to save the world. But now that our government has turned against them, they'll need a new team of allies, including inventor Cade Yeager (Mark Wahlberg) and the fearsome Dinobots!"]

profile:
**User Profile Summary Update:**

- **Primary Interest Area:** The user maintains a strong focus on movies, particularly favoring dramatic narratives intertwined with historical themes, while also enjoying humorous and campy films that present unique concepts.
- **Key Themes:** Interest includes narratives on nuclear war, Cold War tensions, survival scenarios, light-hearted horror/comedy, and an evolving appreciation for emotionally impactful music-centric documentaries.
- **Emotional Engagement:** The user displays a strong emotional connection to stories involving fear, existential threats, and the complexities of creative processes, balanced by a taste for comedic relief in absurd situations.
- **Content Format Preference:** Preference for physical media, particularly DVDs, continues to characterize their viewing habits, alongside a welcoming attitude towards unconventional and genre-blending films.
- **Ratings Tendencies:** Consistently high ratings reflect an appreciation for effective storytelling, emotional resonance, and comedic enjoyment. The user exhibits a flexible rating scale influenced by their diverse interests.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Nostalgic connections remain significant, with an appreciation for both light-hearted comedies from their youth and serious dramas, aligning with their enjoyment of entertaining blockbusters.
- **Genre Affinity:** Core favorites include drama and action-adventure, complemented by a growing interest in music documentaries that showcase artistic talent and creativity, which further enriches their movie experience.
